page.title: 06THE CARILLON
page.content: The carillon is in a memorial tower in the centre of Queens Park for those who died in the two world wars. Inside the tower are military uniforms flags and old fashioned weapons. The carillon is 46m (151ft) in height and has 138 steps to climb.It cost Â£22,000 to build which the public paid for and was finished in 1923.There are 47 bells all of different sizes.The largest bell weighs 4.25 tons and the smallest weighs 9.1kg.There are regular recitals on Thursdays and Sundays throughout the summmer and also a Loughborough Carillon Week in July. The Loughborough Carillon is the first grand carillon in Great Britain and the only municipal carillon.It can play all sorts of tunes from folk songs to classical music .
